metadata.Title: CVE-2021-2307 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Server: Packaging). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.33 and prior and 8.0.23 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with logon to the infrastructure where MySQL Server executes to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks require human interaction from a person other than the attacker. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all MySQL Server accessible data as well as unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 6.1 (Confidentiality and Integrity impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:L/A:N).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-2307` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-client - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-router - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-server - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.25-0ubuntu3').
